title: After Airtel, now Idea also offers an extra 3GB of 4G data to its customers
text:
After Airtel, now Idea also offers an extra 3GB of 4G data... After Airtel, now Idea also offers an extra 3GB of 4G data to its customers By January 12, 2017 “The offer is available to both new and existing prepaid and postpaid users” 
It seems that the competition between telecom operators have reached a new high, as Idea too is now offering extra free data to users on select plans. The “New Year Bonanza” offer can be availed by both existing and new prepaid and postpaid customers. 
Prepaid customers can get 3GB of free 3G/4G data on the Rs 348 recharge pack which also comes with unlimited voice calling and SMS. For users who recharge with this pack on a new 4G handset, the company is also bundling an additional 1GB of 4G data. It’s worth noting that the benefit is valid for 28 days and can be availed for a maximum of 13 times over 365 days. 
Coming to postpaid users, Idea will be providing additional 3GB of 3G/4G data every month till December 31st to subscribers of the Rs 499 and Rs 999 Ultimate plans. The Rs 499 plan will thus offer 6GB (3GB + 3GB free) 3G/4G data, while the Rs 999 plan will come with 11GB (8GB + 3GB free) of 3G/4G data. Both plans also come with unlimited voice calling. This offer is available to both new and existing customers who upgrade to 4G handsets. 
In order to avail additional 3GB data offer, new 4G handset users need to visit the 4G handset section on the My Idea app, or visit this link using the new 4G handset and Idea Internet (not Wi-Fi) and follow the instructions. Recently, Airtel also started offering 3GB of additional data to its 4G users under the Rs 345 plan which comes with unlimited voice calls, 1GB 3G/4G data and 100 SMS per day.
